abstract: Researchers who sought to address criticisms of mainstream thinking on global warming concluded that the consensus was right: 1 degree Centrigrade since 1950.
snippet: Researchers who sought to address criticisms of mainstream thinking on global warming concluded that the consensus was right: 1 degree Centrigrade since 1950.
lead_paragraph: A team at the University of California Berkeley that set out to test the temperature data underlying the consensus on global warming has concluded that the mainstream estimate of the rise in the earth's surface temperature since 1950 is indeed accurate. It has warmed about 1 degree Centigrade (1.8 degrees Fahrenheit), the researchers say. The data sets and research papers are here, along with charts and a video.

headline.main: Global Warming Indeed Under Way, Contrarian Panel Says
